item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia | Six Flags Over Georgia
item.description: If you’re looking for things to do near Atlanta, Six Flags Over Georgia, located in Austell, Georgia, is the must-do destination. It's home to over 45 rides, from the family-friendly Rockin' Tug to the adrenaline-pumping roller coasters like Dare Devil Dive and The Great American Scream Machine.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia - Wikipedia
item.description: Six Flags Over Georgia is a 290-acre (1.2 km 2) amusement park in Mableton, Georgia, United States. Opened in 1967, it is the second park in the Six Flags chain following the original Six Flags Over Texas, which opened in 1961.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia (2026) - Tripadvisor
item.description: Six Flags Over Georgia is Atlanta’s largest, most exciting theme park! If your family is looking for things to do in Atlanta, Georgia, you’ve come to the right place.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia | Tickets, Rides, Hours & Water Park ...
item.description: Located just west of Atlanta in Austell, Georgia, Six Flags Over Georgia combines intense roller coasters, kid-friendly rides, and a full Hurricane Harbor water park — all in a scenic setting surrounded by trees and Southern charm.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia - Discover Atlanta
item.description: As the largest regional theme park in the Southeast, Six Flags Over Georgia is home to more than 40 rides including 12 roller coasters, three water rides and thrill rides.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia opening 2026 dates, tickets, job opportunities
item.description: Six Flags Over Georgia is the largest regional theme park in the southeast with more than 40 rides including 12 roller coasters, according to Discover Atlanta.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia: Everything You Need To Know Before You Go
item.description: Six Flags Over Georgia has reopened for 2021! Here's everything you need to know from ticket costs to cool rides to try at the Austell park.

item.title: Six Flags Over Georgia
item.description: The largest regional theme park in the Southeast, featuring 11 heart-pounding coasters, the all-new Hurricane Harbor water park included with park admission, interactive children's sections and water rides to beat the summer heat. Take on the 20-story Goliath hyper coaster, SkyScreame - a 24-story extreme swing ride - or the world's first hybrid zero gravity slide at Hurricane Harbor, opening ...
